Accessibility.description: Research MethodologyIntroduction to Research Methodology & the Course
Elham Akhondzadeh Noughabi Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology Engineering, Faculty of Industrial and Systems Engineering, Tarbiat Modares University 2020
an “organized, systematic, data-based, critical, scientific inquiry or investigation into a specific problem”, undertaken with the “purpose of finding answers or solutions.”

Discover new information or relationships; to expand and to verify existing knowledge Develop and provide new knowledge; discovery of general principles Theory building Investigation of hypothetical propositions about the presumed relations among natural phenomena To solve problems and for decision making purposes (business & management research)Increase our power to understand & explain, predict, describe & change
Exploration & Discovery We require: An appropriate process of discovery & An appropriate communication of research findings

Definition: ‘Something that people undertake in order to find things out in a systematic way, thereby increasing their knowledge’ Saunders et al. (2009) Characteristics: Data are collected systematically Data are interpreted systematicallyThere is a clear purpose to find things out
Why, What, Where , How & When Questions

What do I want to find out?Why am I doing this research project?Where is the information that I want to find out?How should I answer to the research questions?How will I be assessed?When can I start and when must I finish my work?
How to Do Research: Stages of the Research Process

slide.slideTitle: @How to Do Research: Stages of the Research Process@

Accessibility.description: Your personal feelings and beliefsAccess to dataTime and other resourcesValidity and reliability of the data & results Ethical issues

'Research methodology' refers to the study of research methods. It does not admit of a plural. The theory of how research should be undertaken Saunders et al. (2009) A science of studying how research is done scientificallyA way to systematically solve the research problem by logically adopting various stepsAims to describe and analyze methods and throw light on their limitations an benefitsResearchers should know the relevant method and which are not, know the logic behind the methods we use in the context of our research study and explain why we are using a particular method and why we are not using others
Why Do You Need and Choose Research Methodology ?
This will be your unique opportunity in order to provide a concrete demonstration of your abilities. So:You need an appropriate process of discovery & find a way to communicate the research findings

بايد راهي را بيابيم تا يافته هاي خود را با ديگران مكالمه و مبادله كنيد

Accessibility.description: The aim of this course is to prepare Master Students in Information Technology Engineering to conduct research across the range of IT disciplines such as information systems, information management, big data, data science, security, Internet of Things, Artificial intelligence and Cloud Computing.In this course, the students will learn the basic skills which are essential to become a successful researcher. The objective of the course is to teach research skills in a systematic fashion, early in a student's graduate program. It explains the nature of research, various research strategies, approaches, methods and techniques that are applicable in the fields of IT. This course introduces the principles of research design, research ethics, research methods and techniques of data collection and analysis appropriate to IT research in academic and industry settings.Skills developed and knowledge acquired from this course will prepare students to conduct and communicate their own research, as well as to be knowledgeable and critical interpreters of others' research. We try to provide the students with hints and solutions which could be helpful while facing routine research challenges.

Upon successful completion of this course, students should be able to:know the nature of research and systematic research process design rigorous and ethical Master level research projects and develop project proposals evaluate and select research methods and techniques of data collection and analysis appropriate to particular research designs, projects and disciplines conduct ethical research communicate research findings in written and oral form in research and industry settings critically review research literature, research design and reported findings apply research skills to operate effectively as a member of a research project team

Introduction to Research Methodology & the Course Subject 1 Fundamentals of Research Methodology Subject 2 Generating Research Ideas Subject 3 Critically Reviewing the Literature Subject 4 Writing your Research Proposal Subject 5 Research Onion & Design Subject 6 Ethics in Research Subject 7The Sources and Collectionof Data Subject 8Analyzing Quantitative Data Subject 9Presenting Insights and Findings Subject 10Use of Tools, Methods and Softwares for Research
Course Plan aligned with Research Process

Business Research Methods by Donald Cooper & Pamela SchindlerResearch Methods for Business Students by Mark Saunders, Philip Lewis & Adrian Thornhill Research design: Qualitative, quantitative and mixed methods approaches by John W. Creswell Business Research Methods by Alan Bryman & Emma Bell, Oxford University Press. Research Project Success: The Essential Guide for Science and Engineering StudentsResearch Methodology by C.R.Kothari
Assignments (45%) Mid-term quiz (15%) Final exam (35%) Interaction and Discussion in Class (5%)
